title: The Blair Witch Project
brief_description: In October of 1994 three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, while shooting a documentary. A year later their footage was found.

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

constellations_other.name: Making home movies
constellations_other.description: Home movies have inspired the form and plots of narrative cinema.

recommendations.quote: Not only did The Blair Witch Project scare up $248.6 million USD at the box office, it also created the first viral marketing campaign (which led many people to believe it was true) and ushered in the era of hand-held doco-style found footage horror films.

description: In October of 1994 three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, while shooting a documentary. A year later their footage was found.
